title: Behind the Scenes: Peter Hurley Headshot Intensive Workshop
summary: A vlog-style behind-the-scenes look at a photography workshop led by Peter Hurley. The video showcases students practicing headshot photography, directing models, using various lighting setups, and receiving feedback.

steps.action: Introduction to the workshop environment and checking the live stream setup.
Discussion on directing models, mentioning techniques like the 'squinch' and head tilts.
Student photographer practices shooting a model against a white background.
Directing the model to adjust her expression and shoulder position for a better shot.
Reviewing shots on the camera screen after photographing a model in a black dress.
Using Kino Flo continuous lighting for a headshot session.
Directing the subject to adjust their chin and body position relative to the lights.

key_takeaways: Effective headshot photography relies heavily on directing the subject's expression and posture.
Continuous lighting setups, such as Kino Flo banks, allow for real-time adjustments and 'what you see is what you get' shooting.
Workshops provide a collaborative environment for photographers to practice and review their work immediately.
